subject: RE: [junit] JUnit Framework now used in JTest!! v4.5
msgSnippet: Yeah. This is an advertisment. It s actually a relevent post, but it should have been more clearly identified as a commercially related post, perhaps with an
messageBody:
Yeah. This is an advertisment. It's actually a relevent post, but it should have been more clearly identified as a commercially related post, perhaps with an [ANNOUNCE] prefix in the header line.

That being said, David McCaw used to be our account rep and we were very happy with him and his product before he got shuffled internally to other accounts.

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526

>From: Alexander Zynevich [mailto:java@...]

>Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Framework now used in JTest!! v4.5
>
>
>It was adv. I suspect :) -1
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "mccaw_parasoft" <davidmccaw@...>
>To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Wednesday, May 29, 2002 1:14 AM
>Subject: [junit] JUnit Framework now used in JTest!! v4.5
>
>
>> Just wanted to let everybody know that the latest version of Jtest!
>> is completely compatible with JUnit. JTest can load and execute all
>> of your existing JUnit test classes. It can export its automatically
>> generated test cases into a test class. It can also create a test
>> class template when you wish to define your own test class.
>>
>> In addition to all the functionality you find in JUnit, JTest will
>> automatically generate test cases to test the construction of a class
>> (assuring you that there is no unexpected input that will cause a
>> method to throw an exception). The tool also does static-analysis
>> (automatic enforcement of best coding practices), regression testing,
>> coverage analysis (for both JUnit and Jtest generated test classes),
>> and checks Design By Contract.
>>
>> If anybody is interested in seeing a demo, please contact me as I
>> will be scheduling several over the next few weeks.
>>
>> You can reach me at:
>>
>> dmccaw@...
>> 888-305-0041 x1209
>>
>> For more info, visit http://www.parasoft.com
>>
>> Thanks,
>> David McCaw
>>
>>
>>
